question.body: Blueberries grow best in moderately acidic soils. Which of the following would be an appropriate pH of a soil in which blueberries can be expected to grow well?

response.feedback: Incorrect. pH close to zero is very acidic.
Correct. pH 4.8 is slightly acidic and is close to the pH of black coffee and tomatoes.
Incorrect. pH close to 14 is highly basic.

part.hint: pH below 7 is acidic, above 7 is basic.
Very harsh stomach acid has a pH of 1.5 .
